rComments: It was ok. I was disappointed b/c I was hoping to really analyze famous games in depth but instead the games were scattered. In fact if you came b/c of your videogame passion, I'm sorry. Most of the time it was about some theory from some scrub about some obscure aspect of gaming. She's a VERY dry lecturer. Her monotone put me to sleep every time!

She's great. Her lectures were usually interesting. She's really knowledgeable about video games, and it shows. It's clear she's not only a scholar about them, but a fan as well. That helps. As a film student, I was happy to see the use of film terms thrown into a class about video games. That was cool. Also, she's hot. That never hurts.

Soraya seems like a really nice person but her lectures need some work. Most of the time she read off of her slides in a very monotone voice. However, she really made 120 less tough than it should have been and I appreciate her for that. Workload included only 2 long papers and 5 short papers. Overall, a laid back professor but a dry lecturer.
great, relaxed, fun teaching style. Really clear lectures and the take-home exams are a huge plus.

cool teacher, the lectures were fairly interesting, and i loved the the exams were take home. i definitely recommend the class too, you learn not only about media history/issues but how to work various popular computer programs (photoshop, flash, final cut) as well. it was actually pretty fun.

for contemporary art of tnhe African Diaspora. Awesome teacher. Never gave you more reading than necessary for the topic and explains concepts very well. A fair grader and an outstanding human. Take a HAVC class with her, its worth it.

Video games was fun. TA: Mike Treanor, was the best!!! Her study guide made it easy to study for the test. Everything needed to know for that test is in there. A lot is taken out from the book so if you missed class, then read from the readings. But if you're lazy like me, go to class and take notes. Class was fun and interesting anyways.

Video Games and Visual Culture. She is nice and helpful. The class is super easy if you go to class and take notes. I never once opened the text book and i got an A-. There are a lot of chances for extra credit. Go to section and do the short write ups and it will be super easy.

Video Games and Visual Culture. She is nice and helpful. The class is super easy if you go to class and take notes. I never once opened the text book and i got an A-. There are a lot of chances for extra credit. Go to section and do the short write ups and it will be super easy.

As someone who has no understanding of or interest in art, this was a difficult class for me.  Some of the guest lecturers were interesting, although not all of them.  Murray's lectures were a little hard for me to follow, but she had a lot of good stuff to say. There wasn't too much reading, but I still found it pretty difficult to get through.

Soraya is genuine, extremely intelligent and articulate. She is kind, and helpful -- even to those stupid kids who ask ridiculous questions -- and always responds to questions with a more clear picture of things. She varied media, which was appreciated. She showed videos, documentaries and obviously many images. The text was wonderful, well-chosen.
Soraya is a gem! She is super intelligent, her lectures are like prose. She is definitely hooked into the contemporary art world and it shows. Highly recommended.

Suraya is clearly both interested and knowledgeable about what's happening in the art world now. Her lectures were really interesting and when approached outside of class she was always willing to delve further into subjects. You do need to apply yourself, though.

An interesting class. I don't know that much about art but this kind of opened my mind. She never takes role, but going to class is pretty interesting. Sometimes if a guest speaker is boring that sucks, but its pretty rare and not really anybodies fault. A good class to fulfill a GE, just make sure you get a good TA
